title: St. Alexander Nevsky Cathedral
summary: A Sofia icon of Neo-Byzantine architecture, with massive domes and richly decorated interiors, symbolising Bulgaria’s heritage, independence, and religious devotion.

title: Cité de Carcassonne
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage medieval fortress with double walls and 52 towers, restored by Eugène Viollet-le-Duc, where history, legend, and living heritage meet.

title: Mount Etna
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage active volcano and Europe’s highest, where raw geological power, fertile landscapes, and ancient myth converge.

title: Three Towers of San Marino
summary: A UNESCO site atop Monte Titano, symbolising centuries of independence and resilience in the world’s oldest constitutional republic.

title: Palau de la Música Catalana
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage concert hall showcasing Catalan Modernisme, where architecture, art, and music converge in vibrant colour and light.

title: Kronborg Castle
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage fortress commanding the Øresund Strait, where history, maritime strategy, and Shakespearean legend converge.

title: Dom Luís I Bridge
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage iron arch bridge spanning the Douro, where 19th-century engineering ambition shaped Porto’s riverfront and urban identity.

title: Château de Fontainebleau
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage palace reflecting seven centuries of French monarchy and art, where history, architecture, and landscape blend into a serene and intimate royal retreat.

title: Rocher du Bock
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage fortress remnant carved into rock, bearing witness to centuries of siege, resilience, and strategic power at the heart of Europe.

title: Valle dei Templi
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage landscape where monumental Doric temples rise above the Mediterranean, bearing witness to the power, faith, and ambition of ancient Greek civilisation beyond the mainland.

title: Diocletian's Palace
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage palace where Roman imperial authority and military engineering merge, forming a living urban landscape that has endured for seventeen centuries.

title: Lake Bled
summary: A postcard-perfect Alpine lake shaped by glaciers and legend, where a solitary island, medieval traditions, and mountain scenery come together in one of Slovenia’s most enduring landscapes.

title: Catedral de Santiago de Compostela
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage cathedral built over the tomb of Saint James, standing for over a millennium as the spiritual heart and final destination of the Camino de Santiago.

title: Schweriner Schloss
summary: A UNESCO World Heritage palace rising from Lake Schwerin, expressing dynastic authority and 19th-century historicist architecture shaped by the ambitions of a small European state.
